content.description: Wise Guys Off Size is a burly squeeze climb that only Joe Herbst could have dreamed up. A long voyage that gradually narrows on good rock.
content.protection: Many big bros, large cams, or both. A few small/medium pieces for the start.
content.location: The right most route on the wall.  Wise Guys is the left leaning splitter squeeze and offwidth.  Easily spotted from the trail in advance.  Scramble up bushy ledges to the left to gain the main ledge which accesses Tickled Pink, Beelzebub, and Wise Guys.

content.description: Tickled Pink climbs a steep tight hand crack in a semi-flared corner on the left hand side of the wall.
content.location: The wall which features this route is easily identified by first spotting the huge left leaning offwidth that is Wise Guys Off Size.  To reach the base of this area, continue scrambling of  bushy gully to the left and below the wall.  Some 4th class is involved to gain the main ledge to access this route.

content.description: Rockingstone Groove climbs two undulating cracks in a pink left facing corner. Belay near a flat rocking boulder and mind the rope getting pinched under it!
content.location: About 50 yards up the hill from Da Boneyard

content.description: This climb was canceled before it even began and 13 Mormons were sacrificed by Big Bro before the wide Gods would grant their blessing.This is the kind of route made for gumbies who rack up inadequately and forget their gloves in the haul bag around the corner. So make sure you're a total junkshow, and bring a full rack of hexes and peanuts to sew this bad boy up. Don't forget your gold Big Bro (bomber in that bottom section; 10/10 would whip).And whatever you do, don't touch the choke stone of death lodged precariously in the crack (it's closer to start of the climb and it's made of lava  - you would surely perish). Commit to the wide and worm your way up to where the crack thins down. Good dirty fun to the end. If you don't swear, did you even send?Gear small to tipped out Valley Giant.
content.protection: Single rack .2 - #9 Valley Giant, Blue Big Bro
content.location: Approach as for the lower tier of Rainbow Mountain east. The line is climbers right of the bolted line that's follows the second tier  rappel line. Follow the trail around the corner and you will arrive at the climb quickly. Easily identified by the striking point that continues up and left of the line (you will find the anchors on this face).

content.description: A fun moderate hand crack in a flaring corner.  Surprisingly splitter for 5.8.
content.location: Up the hillside from the Wise Guys Off Size wall, or also downhill from Da Boneyard about 70 yards.

content.description: The Growler climbs a right-facing corner crack first encountered at the base of the mountain just to the south of the large talus/scree drainage and below the wall that features Wise Guys Off Size.  Its a clean cut crack that goes from hands to fists in light colored rock. A good warm up.
content.protection: Double 2"-4" - Tree anchor or walk off.
content.location: Below and left of the route Wise Guys Off Size.

climbs.name: Da Boneyard
climbs.fa: Pat Dezonia, Rob Dezonia, Jerry Handren. Nov 2006

content.description:
Da Boneyard is the striking and long offwidth that splits a tall varnished tower. Possibly the longest single pitch of its type.  Some flakey rock but quite an adventure still. 

  To descend, do two rappels with a 70m.
content.protection: Single rack to 2.5", double 3"-5", triple 5"-12", the kitchen sink.
content.location: Up the hillside from Little Brown, or also about 200 yards downhill from the height of land and center of Rainbow Mountain.

climbs.name: Beelzebub
climbs.fa: Tr: Richard Harrison, First lead: Matt Kuehl. Nov 2012

content.description: Beelzebub climbs a steep and clean offwidth that features very few face holds splitting a beautifully blank wall. One of the nicest offwidths in Red Rock.
content.location: The striking offwidth splitting the center of the wall, just left of Wise Guys Off Size.

content.description: P1. 85' - 10cStem off the boulder and clip  the first bolt. A cruxy sequence gets you through the first three bolts and then thoughtful climbing to the top of the pitch, including a "chimney puzzle". 7 bolts, optional finger cams.P2. 90' - 10c8 bolts of quality face climbing, followed by 2 bolts of heady 5.8 slab to the top. 10 bolts.2 raps gets you back to the bags. This line can be rappelled to descend from the Beelzebub area.
content.protection: Bolts and optional finger sized cams
content.location: This climb follows the bolted line through the two tiers of rock below Wize Guys/Beelzebub.

content.description: The East Face of Rainbow Mountain is home to some nice climbs and wide cracks that are scattered along its base to the south of the height of land in the center of the mountain.  A semi-adventurous craging area that so far has received only what seems like sporadic visits, despite the good quality of most routes.
